page.title: 17SOCIAL ISSUES IN NEWTOWN
page.content: Unempoyment is a national problem and this community shares that concern. A survey of Newtown School's parents showed that employment prospects are their major worry, followed by cuts in expenditure on education particularly in the field of secondary education, which some fear is already failing. Man's effect on the environment, the use of pesticides and food additives, pollution, threats to the countryside and forests are universal concerns but perhaps account for the popularity of the Meon Valley Self Sufficiency Group. Many of the older local families are concerned that their children are forced to leave this area because of lack of employment and houses. High house prices prevent all but those with high salaries from buying. Professional families expect their children to go to follow careers
